required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Biphasic Insulin Aspart 30 Twice Daily With Two Different Initial Dosage Split Regimens in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes: An Extension to Trial BIASP-3756
clinical_study.official_title: An Extension Trial of BIAsp-3756, Explorative Comparison of Biphasic Insulin Aspart 30 Twice Daily With Two Different Initial Dosage Split Regimens on the Effect of Glycaemic Control in Chinese Type 2 Diabetes Patients

brief_summary.textblock: This trial is conducted in Asia. The aim of the trial is to compare the effect on glycaemic control of biphasic insulin aspart 30 twice daily with two different dosage split regimens for Chinese subjects with type 2 diabetes who did not achieve the treatment target of a glycosylated haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) below 7% in trial BIASP-3756 (NCT01123980).

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Glycosylated Haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) From Baseline

secondary_outcome.description: A 9-point SMPG profile included measurements before and 120 minutes after start of breakfast, lunch and main evening meal, measurements prior to bedtime and at 2:00 -4:00 a.m., and one before breakfast the following day

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Below 7.0%
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of subjects achieving the treatment target for glycosylated haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) after 16 weeks of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Below or Equal to 6.5%
secondary_outcome.description: The percentage of subjects achieving the treatment target for glycosylated haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) after 16 weeks of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Treatment Emergent Hypoglycaemic Episodes
secondary_outcome.description: Treatment emergent hypoglycaemic episodes (hypos): those that happened between treatment and one day after last drug day. Hypos summarised based on American Diabetes Association classification. Severe hypos: episodes requiring another person to actively administer resuscitative actions. Minor hypos: episodes with symptoms with plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol/L (56 mg/dL) handled by the subject, or any asymptomatic plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol/L (56 mg/dL). Diurnal period: between 06:00 and 23:59 (both included). Nocturnal period: between 00:00 and 05:59 a.m. (both included).

arm_group.description: After discontinuation of previous treatment of once daily biphasic insulin aspart 30 (BIAsp 30) or insulin glargine combined with metformin and glimepiride in trial BIAsp-3756, subjects were adminstered BIAsp 30 twice daily with initial dosage split regimen of 2/3 and 1/3 total daily dose before breakfast and before dinner, respectively combined with metformin administered orally with meals

After discontinuation of previous treatment of once daily biphasic insulin aspart 30 (BIAsp 30) or insulin glargine combined with metformin and glimepiride in trial BIAsp-3756, subjects were adminstered BIAsp 30 twice daily with initial dosage split regimen of 1/2 and 1/2 total daily dose before breakfast and before dinner, respectively combined with metformin administered orally with meals

intervention.description: Administered subcutaneously (under the skin), twice daily with a dosage of 2/3 and 1/3 total daily dose before breakfast and before dinner, in combination with metformin.
Administered subcutaneously (under the skin), twice daily with a split dosage of 1/2 and 1/2 total daily dose before breakfast and before dinner, in combination with metformin.
Tablets 500 mg administered orally with meals. Pre-trial dose and regimen unchanged

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Finalised 24 weeks of treatment with once daily BIAsp 30 or insulin glargine in combination with metformin and glimepiride in trial BIAsp-3756
- HbA1c above or equal to 7.0%
- Body Mass Index (BMI) below or equal to 40.0 kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known hypoglycaemia unawareness or recurrent major hypoglycaemic episodes in trial BIAsp-3756
- Known proliferative retinopathy or maculopathy requiring acute treatment
- Any disease or condition which the Investigator (trial physician) feels would interfere with the trial

intervention_browse.mesh_term: Insulin degludec, insulin aspart drug combination
Insulin aspart, insulin aspart protamine drug combination 30:70

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This trial was conducted at 20 sites in China.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All subjects who completed the 24 week treatment and did not achieve the target of glycosylated haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) below 7% in trial BIAsp-3756 (NCT01123980) were offered the possibility to go into BIAsp-3883. Subjects continued their previous treatment unchanged from trial BIASP-3756 and throughout the one-week screening period.

group.title: BIAsp 30 (2:1)
group.description: After discontinuation of previous treatment of once daily biphasic insulin aspart 30 (BIAsp 30) or insulin glargine combined with metformin and glimepiride in trial BIAsp-3756, subjects were adminstered BIAsp 30 twice daily with initial dosage split regimen of 2/3 and 1/3 total daily dose before breakfast and before dinner, respectively combined with metformin administered orally with meals

group.title: BIAsp 30 (1:1)
group.description: After discontinuation of previous treatment of once daily biphasic insulin aspart 30 (BIAsp 30) or insulin glargine combined with metformin and glimepiride in trial BIAsp-3756, subjects were adminstered BIAsp 30 twice daily with initial dosage split regimen of 1/2 and 1/2 total daily dose before breakfast and before dinner, respectively combined with metformin administered orally with meals

group.description: After discontinuation of previous treatment of once daily biphasic insulin aspart 30 (BIAsp 30) or insulin glargine combined with metformin and glimepiride in trial BIAsp-3756, subjects were adminstered BIAsp 30 twice daily with initial dosage split regimen of 2/3 and 1/3 total daily dose before breakfast and before dinner, respectively combined with metformin administered orally with meals

group.description: After discontinuation of previous treatment of once daily biphasic insulin aspart 30 (BIAsp 30) or insulin glargine combined with metformin and glimepiride in trial BIAsp-3756, subjects were adminstered BIAsp 30 twice daily with initial dosage split regimen of 1/2 and 1/2 total daily dose before breakfast and before dinner, respectively combined with metformin administered orally with meals

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Change in Glycosylated Haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) From Baseline
outcome.population: Full analysis set using LOCF (last observation carried forward) consists of all randomised subjects who were exposed to at least one dose of the trial product(s). Six patients discontinued trial without any post randomisation HbA1c measurements.

group.title: BIAsp 30 (2:1)
group.description: After discontinuation of previous treatment of once daily biphasic insulin aspart 30 (BIAsp 30) or insulin glargine combined with metformin and glimepiride in trial BIAsp-3756, subjects were adminstered BIAsp 30 twice daily with initial dosage split regimen of 2/3 and 1/3 total daily dose before breakfast and before dinner, respectively combined with metformin administered orally with meals

group.description: After discontinuation of previous treatment of once daily biphasic insulin aspart 30 (BIAsp 30) or insulin glargine combined with metformin and glimepiride in trial BIAsp-3756, subjects were adminstered BIAsp 30 twice daily with initial dosage split regimen of 1/2 and 1/2 total daily dose before breakfast and before dinner, respectively combined with metformin administered orally with meals

measure.title: Change in Glycosylated Haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) From Baseline
measure.population: Full analysis set using LOCF (last observation carried forward) consists of all randomised subjects who were exposed to at least one dose of the trial product(s). Six patients discontinued trial without any post randomisation HbA1c measurements.

analysis.groups_desc: The null hypothesis is H0: μBIAsp 30 (2:1) – μBIAsp 30 (1:1) = 0 against the alternative hypothesis HA: μBIAsp 30 (2:1) – μBIAsp 30 (1:1) ≠ 0. This trial is an extension to BIAsp-3756 (NCT01123980), hence no particular sample size calculation was made.

outcome.title: 9-point SMPG (Self Measured Plasma Glucose) Profile
outcome.description: A 9-point SMPG profile included measurements before and 120 minutes after start of breakfast, lunch and main evening meal, measurements prior to bedtime and at 2:00 -4:00 a.m., and one before breakfast the following day
outcome.population: Full analysis set using LOCF (last observation carried forward) consists of all randomised subjects who were exposed to at least one dose of the trial product(s).

group.title: BIAsp 30 (2:1)
group.description: After discontinuation of previous treatment of once daily biphasic insulin aspart 30 (BIAsp 30) or insulin glargine combined with metformin and glimepiride in trial BIAsp-3756, subjects were adminstered BIAsp 30 twice daily with initial dosage split regimen of 2/3 and 1/3 total daily dose before breakfast and before dinner, respectively combined with metformin administered orally with meals

group.title: BIAsp 30 (1:1)
group.description: After discontinuation of previous treatment of once daily biphasic insulin aspart 30 (BIAsp 30) or insulin glargine combined with metformin and glimepiride in trial BIAsp-3756, subjects were adminstered BIAsp 30 twice daily with initial dosage split regimen of 1/2 and 1/2 total daily dose before breakfast and before dinner, respectively combined with metformin administered orally with meals

measure.title: 9-point SMPG (Self Measured Plasma Glucose) Profile
measure.description: A 9-point SMPG profile included measurements before and 120 minutes after start of breakfast, lunch and main evening meal, measurements prior to bedtime and at 2:00 -4:00 a.m., and one before breakfast the following day
measure.population: Full analysis set using LOCF (last observation carried forward) consists of all randomised subjects who were exposed to at least one dose of the trial product(s).

analysis.groups_desc: A mixed effect model was fitted to the 9-point SMPG profile data. The model included treatment, time, interaction between treatment and time and previous therapy (BIAsp 30 OD/insulin glargine OD) as factors and subject as random effect. From the model, mean profile by treatment and relevant treatment differences was estimated and explored.
analysis.p_value_desc: P-value for parallelism was overall test for parallel time profiles between treatment groups, i.e. time by treatment group interaction effect.
analysis.estimate_desc: Confidence interval is before breakfast profile

analysis.groups_desc: A mixed effect model was fitted to the 9-point SMPG profile data. The model included treatment, time, interaction between treatment and time and previous therapy (BIAsp-30 once daily (OD)/insulin glargine OD) as factors and subject as random effect. From the model, mean profile by treatment and relevant treatment differences was estimated and explored.
analysis.p_value_desc: P-value for parallelism was overall test for parallel time profiles between treatment groups, i.e. time by treatment group interaction effect.
analysis.estimate_desc: Confidence interval is two hours after breakfast profile

outcome.title: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Below 7.0%
outcome.description: The percentage of subjects achieving the treatment target for glycosylated haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) after 16 weeks of treatment
outcome.population: Full analysis set using LOCF (last observation carried forward) consists of all randomised subjects who were exposed to at least one dose of the trial product(s).

group.title: BIAsp 30 (2:1)
group.description: After discontinuation of previous treatment of once daily biphasic insulin aspart 30 (BIAsp 30) or insulin glargine combined with metformin and glimepiride in trial BIAsp-3756, subjects were adminstered BIAsp 30 twice daily with initial dosage split regimen of 2/3 and 1/3 total daily dose before breakfast and before dinner, respectively combined with metformin administered orally with meals

group.title: BIAsp 30 (1:1)
group.description: After discontinuation of previous treatment of once daily biphasic insulin aspart 30 (BIAsp 30) or insulin glargine combined with metformin and glimepiride in trial BIAsp-3756, subjects were adminstered BIAsp 30 twice daily with initial dosage split regimen of 1/2 and 1/2 total daily dose before breakfast and before dinner, respectively combined with metformin administered orally with meals

measure.title: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Below 7.0%
measure.description: The percentage of subjects achieving the treatment target for glycosylated haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) after 16 weeks of treatment
measure.population: Full analysis set using LOCF (last observation carried forward) consists of all randomised subjects who were exposed to at least one dose of the trial product(s).

analysis.groups_desc: Responder analyses were based on logistics regression model using treatment and previous therapy (BIAsp 30 OD or insulin glargine OD) as factors and baseline HbA1c as covariate.
analysis.estimate_desc: The odds ratio and 95% confidence interval for the HbA1c below 7% treatment target were included.

outcome.title: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Below or Equal to 6.5%
outcome.description: The percentage of subjects achieving the treatment target for glycosylated haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) after 16 weeks of treatment
outcome.population: Full analysis set using LOCF (last observation carried forward) consists of all randomised subjects who were exposed to at least one dose of the trial product(s).

group.title: BIAsp 30 (2:1)
group.description: After discontinuation of previous treatment of once daily biphasic insulin aspart 30 (BIAsp 30) or insulin glargine combined with metformin and glimepiride in trial BIAsp-3756, subjects were adminstered BIAsp 30 twice daily with initial dosage split regimen of 2/3 and 1/3 total daily dose before breakfast and before dinner, respectively combined with metformin administered orally with meals

group.title: BIAsp 30 (1:1)
group.description: After discontinuation of previous treatment of once daily biphasic insulin aspart 30 (BIAsp 30) or insulin glargine combined with metformin and glimepiride in trial BIAsp-3756, subjects were adminstered BIAsp 30 twice daily with initial dosage split regimen of 1/2 and 1/2 total daily dose before breakfast and before dinner, respectively combined with metformin administered orally with meals

measure.title: Percentage of Subjects Achieving HbA1c Below or Equal to 6.5%
measure.description: The percentage of subjects achieving the treatment target for glycosylated haemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) after 16 weeks of treatment
measure.population: Full analysis set using LOCF (last observation carried forward) consists of all randomised subjects who were exposed to at least one dose of the trial product(s).

analysis.groups_desc: Responder analyses were based on logistics regression model using treatment and previous therapy (BIAsp 30 OD or insulin glargine OD) as factors and baseline HbA1c as covariate.
analysis.method_desc: The estimates were from a normal linear regression model with treatment and previous insulin as factors, and baseline value as a covariate
analysis.estimate_desc: The odds ratio and 95% confidence interval for the HbA1c below or equal to 6.5% treatment target were included.

outcome.title: Number of Treatment Emergent Hypoglycaemic Episodes
outcome.description: Treatment emergent hypoglycaemic episodes (hypos): those that happened between treatment and one day after last drug day. Hypos summarised based on American Diabetes Association classification. Severe hypos: episodes requiring another person to actively administer resuscitative actions. Minor hypos: episodes with symptoms with plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol/L (56 mg/dL) handled by the subject, or any asymptomatic plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol/L (56 mg/dL). Diurnal period: between 06:00 and 23:59 (both included). Nocturnal period: between 00:00 and 05:59 a.m. (both included).
outcome.population: Full analysis set using LOCF (last observation carried forward) consists of all randomised subjects who were exposed to at least one dose of the trial product(s).

group.title: BIAsp 30 (2:1)
group.description: After discontinuation of previous treatment of once daily biphasic insulin aspart 30 (BIAsp 30) or insulin glargine combined with metformin and glimepiride in trial BIAsp-3756, subjects were adminstered BIAsp 30 twice daily with initial dosage split regimen of 2/3 and 1/3 total daily dose before breakfast and before dinner, respectively combined with metformin administered orally with meals

group.title: BIAsp 30 (1:1)
group.description: After discontinuation of previous treatment of once daily biphasic insulin aspart 30 (BIAsp 30) or insulin glargine combined with metformin and glimepiride in trial BIAsp-3756, subjects were adminstered BIAsp 30 twice daily with initial dosage split regimen of 1/2 and 1/2 total daily dose before breakfast and before dinner, respectively combined with metformin administered orally with meals

measure.title: Number of Treatment Emergent Hypoglycaemic Episodes
measure.description: Treatment emergent hypoglycaemic episodes (hypos): those that happened between treatment and one day after last drug day. Hypos summarised based on American Diabetes Association classification. Severe hypos: episodes requiring another person to actively administer resuscitative actions. Minor hypos: episodes with symptoms with plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol/L (56 mg/dL) handled by the subject, or any asymptomatic plasma glucose below 3.1 mmol/L (56 mg/dL). Diurnal period: between 06:00 and 23:59 (both included). Nocturnal period: between 00:00 and 05:59 a.m. (both included).
measure.population: Full analysis set using LOCF (last observation carried forward) consists of all randomised subjects who were exposed to at least one dose of the trial product(s).

analysis.groups_desc: The number of hypos was analysed using a negative binomial regression model with a log-link function and the logarithm of the time period in which a hypo is considered emergent as offset. The model included treatment and previous therapy (BIAsp 30 OD/insulin glargine OD) as factors. The rate ratio was estimated and 95% confidence intervals were calculated accordingly.

The number of hypos was analysed using a negative binomial regression model with a log-link function and the logarithm of the time period in which a hypo is considered emergent as offset. The model included treatment and previous therapy (BIAsp 30 OD/insulin glargine OD) as factors. The rate ratio was estimated and 95% confidence intervals were calculated accordingly.

The number of hypos was analysed using a negative binomial regression model with a log-link function and the logarithm of the time period in which a hypo is considered emergent as offset. The model included treatment and previous therapy (BIAsp 30 OD/insulin glargine OD) as factors. The rate ratio was estimated and 95% confidence intervals were calculated accordingly.

The number of hypos was analysed using a negative binomial regression model with a log-link function and the logarithm of the time period in which a hypo is considered emergent as offset. The model included treatment and previous therapy (BIAsp 30 OD/insulin glargine OD) as factors. The rate ratio was estimated and 95% confidence intervals were calculated accordingly.

reported_events.time_frame: The adverse events were collected in a timespan of 17 weeks.
reported_events.desc: The safety analysis set contained all subjects exposed to at least one dose of investigational products.

group.title: BIAsp 30 (2:1)
group.description: After discontinuation of previous treatment of once daily biphasic insulin aspart 30 (BIAsp 30) or insulin glargine combined with metformin and glimepiride in trial BIAsp-3756, subjects were adminstered BIAsp 30 twice daily with initial dosage split regimen of 2/3 and 1/3 total daily dose before breakfast and before dinner, respectively combined with metformin administered orally with meals

group.title: BIAsp 30 (1:1)
group.description: After discontinuation of previous treatment of once daily biphasic insulin aspart 30 (BIAsp 30) or insulin glargine combined with metformin and glimepiride in trial BIAsp-3756, subjects were adminstered BIAsp 30 twice daily with initial dosage split regimen of 1/2 and 1/2 total daily dose before breakfast and before dinner, respectively combined with metformin administered orally with meals

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Novo Nordisk reserves the right to not release data until specified milestones, e.g. when the clinical trial report is available. At the end of the trial, one or more manuscripts for publication will be prepared collaboratively between Investigator(s) and Novo Nordisk. Novo Nordisk reserves the right to postpone publication and/or communication for less than 60 days to protect intellectual property.
